sen.j: 兄・尚政と同様に有能かつ京都周辺の領地を支配したため、京都所司代代理・大坂城代代理を歴任し、禁裏造営の奉行や大坂城普請を務めるなど、幕府からの信任は厚かった。
sen.e: As he was capable as with his older brother Naomasa and ruled the territory around Kyoto, he was trusted by bakufu and engaged in the construction of Imperial Palace and Osaka-jo castle as the deputy Kyotoshoshidai (Governor-General of Kyoto) and the deputy Osakajodai (the keeper of Osaka-jo castle).

Since he was as capable as his older brother Naomasa and ruled the territory around Kyoto, he was trusted by bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and engaged in the construction of the Imperial Palace and Osaka-jo Castle as the deputy Kyotoshoshidai (Governor-General of Kyoto) and the deputy Osakajodai (the keeper of Osaka-jo Castle).
sen.cmt: 最初の部分を修正しました。(Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) を補いました。the を挿入し、castle→Castle と修正しました。
sen.e: Since he was as capable as his older brother Naomasa and ruled the territory around Kyoto, he was trusted by bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and engaged in the construction of the Imperial Palace and Osaka-jo Castle as the deputy Kyotoshoshidai (Governor-General of Kyoto) and the deputy Osakajodai (the keeper of Osaka-jo Castle).

sen.j: 藩政においても、城下町の整備や拡大、治水工事を務めて実高6000石を増加させるなど、藩政の基礎を固めた。
sen.e: In his own territory, he strived to construct and expand a casle town, increased the actual harvest by 6,000 koku through the flood prevention work and established the basis of domain duties.

In his own territory, he worked on the maintenance and expansion of the castle town, increased the actual harvest by 6,000 koku through the flood prevention work and so on, established the basis of domain duties.
